body.p:
Mount Vernon Rockcastle Co Ky
To The Hon the Governor of Kentucky

Your Petitioner Newton Whitehead states that at the February Term 1863 ^of the Rockcastle Circuit Court^ he was fined ^$20^ for retailing whiskey together with some others during the rebel Excitement. The Govenor was petitioned in several cases alike all the ballance were remitted if your Petitioners fine was remitted it fell into the hands of the Rebels and was destroyed. He asks your honor to remit his fine as he is a very poor man and the armies have taken nearly everything he has. we think it would be an act of charity to remit it as in duty bound we will ever pray.
We the under signed know the above facts to be true and ask you to remit his fine

B K Bethurum Judge of the Rockcastle County Courty
Wm McClure Sheriff R.C.
James G Carter
Edwin Shivel
J. J. Williams
W. M. Fish Clerk Rockcastle County Court
E T Fish Clerk Rockcastle Circuit Court
W. A. Brooks
Simply from the consideration of the well known suffering of the people in that section the fine is ordered to be remitted except costs & fees.
